commitResults.messageBody:
Project supports simple CRUD functionalities, but the changes made to the listed tasks are not permanently saved onto the hard drive of the user's device.

This prevents previous changes made to the task list from being 'remembered' by the program, rendering the program useless should the user wish to save past tasks.

This commit introduces two new methods:
* getFileContents
* updateFileContents
getFileContents retrieves the information of all previously made tasks (todos, deadlines, and events) from a CSV file (which serves as the database) and returns an ArrayList<Task> containing all these tasks, allowing for the program to interact with past tasks.
updateFileContents iterates through the ArrayList<Task> and writes each and every task onto the CSV file upon being called. It is placed at the end of every CRUD method found in the program.

Now the program is able to output previously created tasks through reading the contents of the 'database.csv' file!

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' into branch-Level-7 Making 'branch-Level-7' the same with 'master'

commitResults.messageBody:
Current tasks utilise Strings to represent date and time of 'event' and 'deadline' tasks, which are not as ideal as using LocalDateTime data types.

The relevant fields have been changed to store LocalDateTime types, allowing for clearer and standardised storage of timings and printing of deadlines.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more OOP features to source code
commitResults.messageBody:
All of the code is currently stored in a single class 'Blob' with the use of nested classes (e.g. Task, Deadline, Todo...).

Separation of Nested Classes into separate files. Creation of more classes such as Ui, Storage, Parser and TaskList.

Use of separate files for the different varying classes makes it much easier for the developer to isolate each portion of the code. Addition of more classes (such as Ui, Storage, Parser, and TaskList) help to abstract away more code for easier understanding and debugging.

commitResults.messageTitle: Organise all classes in package blob
commitResults.messageBody:
Program cannot be imported out as it is not packaged

All classes are not organised under a singular package, 'blob'.

Now program can be imported.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/add-gradle-support' Merging origin/add-gradle-support into master

commitResults.messageBody:
No automated tests initially to test certain classes and their methods.

This makes it harder to isolate bugs should the program run into an error.

Introducing StorageTest and TaskListTest helps to isolate bugs that may arise due to issues with the code in TaskList and Storage.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDocs to all classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Existing Classes and Methods do not have headers explaining what they do and their role.

JavaDocs was added to all classes and methods.

This allows the developer to have greater clarity when it comes to remembering what each and every class / method does, expediting the programming process.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7' For submission tracking purposes...
Refactor Source Code to meet Coding Standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Current code doesn't follow coding standards, thus impeding clarity when scanning through the multiple files, potentially leading to slower bug finding efforts.

Changing of code to abide by the coding standards allows for consistent style throughout, allowing for smooth debugging / project building progress.

User can only 'list' out all existing tasks to see more than one task that is currently recorded in the database.

Lack of a search functionality renders the user unable to sieve out specific tasks, especially once more and more tasks get added to the database.

The adding of the 'find' command allows the user to sift out specific tasks that contain that keyword, allowing for improved user experience.

Blob is currently using a text-based UI.

Integrating a GUI makes Blob easier to use and more engaging.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to Storage, Deadline and Event files
commitResults.messageBody:
CSV file for data storage is assumed to already have the proper headers, while the deadlines and relevant time periods entered by the user are assumed to be logical timings for both the deadline and event tasks created.

Inappropriate dates entered may render the tasks created useless and of little utility to the user, and may perhaps interfere with future iterations to the project which leverage on the created tasks having proper and logical dates.

Assertions have been added to ensure only deadlines past the time the user creates the task can be used. Same goes with the duration of event tasks as indicated by the user.
Add assertions to Storage, Deadline and Event files

Non-standardised variable namings present throughout codespace.

Changing of variable names to adhere to coding quality, such as giving names that more intuitively describe what the variable holds, making method names verbs, prevention of misleading variable names.

Doing as such allows for greater readability and clarity when analysing the codebase for future bugs. Also allows for more expedient understanding when code is read by other users.
Adherence to Coding Quality

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Tagging Feature to all tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Current tasks are differentiated by types (Todo, Deadline, Event), but within each subtype, there isn't any other way to differentiate the tasks into smaller subgroups.

With the addition of the tagging feature, tasks now can be classified under different categories as determined by the user (e.g. #academics), with each task being able to have an unlimited number of tags.

Now the user would be able to visually group related tasks (which are associated with the same tags) together, adding greater utility to Blob as a task tracking app.
Add Tagging Feature to all tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor of Code to fit Coding Standards
commitResults.messageBody:
The evaluateAction() method in Parser is extremely long.

The length of the method obscures the clarity of what it actually does
& makes the rectifying of bugs less expedient.

Let's separate all the various commands into separate methods to leverage
on the SLAP method, while keeping the method short and concise.

Lack of relevant User guide and picture of messenger interface.

The product is less intriging to potential users due to the lack
of visual aids and a consumer-friendly explanation of what the
product does.

Let's add a .png file showcasing the first thing the user sees
when they run the product. A proper User Guide also helps users
to better understand how to use / navigate the product!

Database creation / access path is based off the layout in IntelliJ

The many different folders and directory's in the layout of Intelllij
mis different from that when the user downloads the JAR file into their
own folder, making it vulnerable to errors when run as a JAR file in a
folder that does not have the same layout.

Let's change the path to make it not dependent on other folders, and
just have it created in the same directory as the JAR file.

The updateFileContents() method as well as the getFileContents()
method utilised if-else statements

This  makes the code less readable given how it makes the code
more nested.

Let's change these if-else statements to 'switch' statements
instead, making the code more palatable to the eye.
Update User Guide
Update User Guide Again
Update User Guide
Update User Guide Again
Debug Parser.java
